narratives.question_text: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload
comments: I really found the homework assignments reasonable and the tests bearable.
All required work for this course reinforced the skills we were expected to learn, and practice sets, exams (and the project) ensured we acquired and internalized what was discussed in class.
Homework throughout the term is reasonable and the final project is very big, but manageable if students plan ahead.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
comments: Very well organized, with logical progression over the course of the semester.

The organization of the course makes sense, and the topics build logically on each other for the most part. The syllabus does not include any of the assignments or tests. The course clearly has a definite plan - a little more information on the syllabus would be useful, particularly at the start of the semester.
Beautifully organized - so clear and methodical.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
comments: Jeff is an excellent instructor, with a firm understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of this students and the challenges they will encounter with the material. He approaches class with caring and a sense of humor, and goes out of his way for his students (bringing breakfast, setting aside additional time for tutoring sessions). I am extremely grateful to Jeff for his time and commitment to my learning.
Jeff made me look forward to Accounting on a Monday morning, no small feat.
Jeff is a great teacher, especially of this material.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on: Visitors, if any
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
comments: I don't know how well I understand the material but I did feel very confident when it was time to do the final project, so that seemed to be proof positive of my learning. I hope this all stays in my brain!

The assignments in this course, exams and project all forced me to thoroughly learn and internalize the material, which is excellent - it ensures that I will retain it and be able to use it in the future.
Before this course, I don't think I really knew what an asset is. The course gives a great foundation in the basics that has already been useful in my other classes at YSD.
I think this is an excellent entry-level course in accounting with the perfect instructor.

The last few classes after the basics are covered (for example, Payroll) are different enough from the material that came before that they were a little confusing. It would be useful to understand how they fit into the arc of the course earlier, so we can be better prepared to take away what we need.
